conflict_detection_enabled_description: Specifies whether to enable conflict detection for all deploy and retrieve commands executed from VS Code
data_query_selection_text: SFDX: Execute SOQL Query with Currently Selected Text
delete_source_text: SFDX: Delete from Project and Org
delete_source_this_source_text: SFDX: Delete This from Project and Org
deploy_in_manifest_text: SFDX: Deploy Source in Manifest to Org
deploy_this_source_text: SFDX: Deploy This Source to Org
enable_sobject_refresh_on_startup_descri: If a project has no sObject definitions, specifies whether to automatically refresh sObject definitions on extension activation (true) or not (false).
enable_source_tracking_for_deploy_and_re: Specifies whether source-tracking is enabled for deploy or retrieve operations in a source-tracked org. Disable source-tracking if you are experiencing performance issues using deploy or retrieve commands on your source-tracked orgs.
ignore_conflicts_on_push_description: Specifies whether to always use --ignore-conflicts when you run project:deploy:start on save
isv_bootstrap_command_text: SFDX: Create and Set Up Project for ISV Debugging
launch_apex_replay_debugger_with_current: SFDX: Launch Apex Replay Debugger with Current File
org_create_default_scratch_org_text: SFDX: Create a Default Scratch Org...
org_display_default_text: SFDX: Display Org Details for Default Org
org_list_clean_text: SFDX: Remove Deleted and Expired Orgs
org_login_access_token_text: SFDX: Authorize an Org using Session ID
org_logout_all_text: SFDX: Log Out from All Authorized Orgs
org_logout_default_text: SFDX: Log Out from Default Org
prefer_deploy_on_save_enabled_descriptio: Specifies whether to always run deploy instead of push when a local source file is saved and `Push or deploy on save` is enabled.
project_deploy_start_default_org_text: SFDX: Push Source to Default Org
project_deploy_start_ignore_conflicts_de: SFDX: Push Source to Default Org and Ignore Conflicts
project_retrieve_start_default_org_text: SFDX: Pull Source from Default Org
project_retrieve_start_ignore_conflicts_: SFDX: Pull Source from Default Org and Ignore Conflicts
push_or_deploy_on_save_enabled_descripti: Specifies whether or not to automatically push (for source-tracked orgs) or deploy (for non-source-tracked orgs) when a local source file is saved.
push_or_deploy_on_save_show_output_panel: Specifies whether to switch to the Output panel when a local source file is saved.
retrieve_in_manifest_text: SFDX: Retrieve Source in Manifest from Org
retrieve_test_code_coverage_text: Specifies whether code coverage results are calculated and retrieved when you run Apex tests.
retrieve_this_source_text: SFDX: Retrieve This Source from Org
setting_clear_output_tab_description: When a new command is run, clear the output content from the previous command.
telemetry_tag_description: Specifies the tag to include in telemetry data sent to Salesforce.
use_new_org_browser_description: Use the new Org Browser extension. When disabled, uses the legacy Org Browser.
show_cli_success_msg_description: Specifies whether status messages for Salesforce CLI commands run using the VS Code command palette will appear as pop-up information messages (true) or as status bar messages (false).
start_apex_debug_logging: SFDX: Turn On Apex Debug Log for Replay Debugger
stop_apex_debug_logging: SFDX: Turn Off Apex Debug Log for Replay Debugger
telemetry_enabled_description: Specifies whether to enable Salesforce telemetry. Even when enabled, still abides by the overall `telemetry.enableTelemetry` vscode setting.
view_all_changes_text: SFDX: View All Changes (Local and in Default Org)
view_remote_changes_text: SFDX: View Changes in Default Org
org_browser_walkthrough_description: Browse and retrieve your org's metadata types and components using the Org Browser.
org_browser_walkthrough_open_description:
Access the Org Browser by clicking the **cloud icon** in the VS Code Primary Sidebar. When you open the Org Browser, all metadata for your default org is cached locally under the '.sfdx' directory to minimize API calls.

[Open Org Browser](command:workbench.view.extension.metadata)

*Learn more: [Org Browser Documentation](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/platform/sfvscode-extensions/guide/org-browser.html)*
org_browser_walkthrough_browse_descripti:
The Org Browser lists all **metadata types** in your default org. To view components, expand any metadata type. You can:

• **View metadata types** - ApexClass, CustomObject, Flow, etc.
• **Expand folders** - Reports, Dashboards, Documents, EmailTemplates
• **See field details** - Custom Object fields show type information
• **Refresh metadata** - Use refresh icons to update org-level or type-level data

Expand metadata types with folders to see all available folders and their components.
org_browser_walkthrough_retrieve_descrip:
Retrieve metadata components directly to your local project without using a 'package.xml' manifest file:

• **Single component** - Click the retrieve icon next to any component name
• **All components of a type** - Click the retrieve icon next to the metadata type
• **Folder contents** - Expand folders and retrieve individual components

Retrieved source goes into your default package directory as defined in 'sfdx-project.json'. If retrieving overwrites existing components, you'll be prompted to choose how to proceed.
connected_org_walkthrough_description: Connect to and manage your Salesforce orgs. Learn about default org concepts and management.
connected_org_walkthrough_understand_des:
Salesforce Extensions runs commands against your **default org**. The type of org depends on your development model:

• **Package development model** - Typically a scratch org for isolated development
• **Org development model** - Usually a sandbox, Developer Edition (DE) org, or Trailhead Playground

Your default org is displayed in the VS Code footer and determines where your commands execute.

*Learn more: [Default Org Documentation](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/platform/sfvscode-extensions/guide/default-org.html)*
connected_org_walkthrough_set_title: Set or Change Your Default Org
connected_org_walkthrough_set_descriptio:
To set or change the org you're developing against:

**Using VS Code Activity Bar:**
1. Click the **org alias** or **plug icon**
2. Select a different org or choose **SFDX: Set a Default Org** to authorize a new org

**Using Command Palette:**
1. **SFDX: Authorize an Org** - Connect to an existing org, or
2. **SFDX: Create a Default Scratch Org** - Create a new scratch org, or
3. **SFDX: Set a Default Org**

[Set Default Org](command:sf.set.default.org)
connected_org_walkthrough_open_title: Open and Manage Your Default Org
connected_org_walkthrough_open_descripti:
Once you have a default org set, you can easily access it:

**Open your default org:**
1. Click the open org icon next to the default org icon in the footer, or
2. Use Command Palette: **SFDX: Open Default Org**

**Manage your org:**
To manage your default org, you can:
1. **SFDX: Log Out from Default Org**
2. **SFDX: Display Org Details for Default Org**

Opening your org launches it in your default browser for easy access to the Salesforce interface.
